channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: Central Asia’s Mounting Debt Burden: Risks and Policy Implications
item.description: Rising repayment pressures are narrowing fiscal space and testing the sustainability of the region’s development model.

item.title: The Trial of Abe’s Assassin Is a Test of Takaichi’s Appetite for Political Reform
item.description: Yamagami Tetsuya's trial will renew attention to the powerful effect of religious groups in Japanese politics, and the LDP’s history of opaque fundraising. Will Takaichi address those issues?

item.title: ‘Respectful Responder’: How India Is Reshaping Regional Security Partnership
item.description: Wary of accusations of hegemonism, India is shying away from the label “net security provider” in favor of a new model.

item.title: Can Crisis Preparedness Information Move Taiwanese From Awareness to Action?
item.description: Taiwan’s government has in recent years stepped up efforts to strengthen public communication amid growing security and disaster risks. But does this kind of guidance actually changes people's actions?

item.title: 5 Things to Watch in South Asia Next Year
item.description: The region faces some risks after a tumultuous 2025.

item.title: Why China Is Not Betting on Its Relationship With the Kuomintang
item.description: As Beijing’s envisioned “peaceful reunification” becomes increasingly impossible, its relationship with the KMT must be viewed with greater caution and, more importantly, with less hope.

item.title: The Case for European Nationalism
item.description: Despite US President Donald Trump’s claims to the contrary, Europe’s problem is not too much integration but too little. To endure in a world increasingly dominated by continental powers, the European Union must complete its common institutions and forge a shared political identity capable of sustaining them.

item.title: The World Order After 2025
item.description: While the term “polycrisis” can be useful in describing the tangle of threats the world currently faces, it fails to capture our role in creating – or finding a way out of – our current situation. While profound disruption carries acute risks, it also provides a rare opening for far-reaching transformation.

item.title: What to Watch in Africa in 2026
item.description: From a high-stakes election in Ethiopia to a brewing crisis in South Sudan.

item.title: What’s at Stake for the China-South Korea Summit: Avoiding a 2nd THAAD Dispute
item.description: Lee's visit is positive sign for China-South Korea relations. But both sides must heed the lessons from the THAAD dispute.

item.title: What to Make of Australia’s Youth Social Media Ban?
item.description: The new policy restricts children under the age of 16 from having accounts on major social media platforms. It also positions Australia as a world leader on the issue.

item.title: Cover Story newsletter: The angst over affordability
item.description: An exclusive look at how we designed our cover

item.title: Trump, Honduras, and the Monroe Doctrine 2.0
item.description: The United States is reasserting influence in Latin America – with a particular focus on China – through overt political signaling. Honduras is the most obvious test case.

item.title: 10 Conflicts to Watch in 2026
item.description: Major wars, simmering hostilities, and accelerating instability from Washington.

item.title: Silicon Valley Socialism
item.description: Tech titans like Elon Musk are offering us a future of socialism from above, where they keep the means of production while everyone else gets an allowance. But if the allowance is high enough, should we care who owns the algorithms and data centers?

item.title: What Will 2026 Bring for China-US Relations?
item.description: 2025 reset the rules of engagement between the two – and China was the relative winner.

item.title: Thailand Releases 18 Cambodian POWs
item.description: Truce holds after allegations of breaches, Cambodia bans all drone flights.

item.title: German Diplomacy at a Time of Japan-China Tensions
item.description: Berlin is navigating a particularly tricky path.

item.title: The West Is Not Ready for a Multipolar World
item.description: The world is shifting from a largely hegemonic international system to a more fragmented, contested, and multipolar set of arrangements. In this environment, the central question for the West is not how to revive a dying order, but how to operate credibly and responsibly in one where influence must be shared.

item.title: The Most Anticipated Books of the Year
item.description: The 30 biggest releases in foreign affairs, history, and political science.

item.title: 2025 in review: Space Force
Climate Adaptation More Than Covers Its Cost
item.description: Effective climate adaptation can strengthen countries’ resilience, protect vulnerable communities, and support economic growth. But while the world has the tools, the level of investment needed to close today’s adaptation gap, let alone to address likely future needs, has fallen far short.

item.title: 2025: A Challenging Year for India’s Diplomacy
item.description: Trump’s tariffs and his courting of Pakistan were major setbacks. Improving relations with China and the steady friendship with Russia were silver linings.

item.title: Southeast Asia Faces a Challenging 2026
item.description: Policymakers in the region have a lot on their minds.

item.title: A Middle Way for American Foreign Policy
item.description: Neither overreach nor retreat can win domestic support.

item.title: The Case for a Grand Bargain Between America and China
item.description: How Trump and Xi can reset relations.

item.title: Pakistan’s Worsening Threat Landscape in 2025
item.description: The TTP’s growing attacks in Pakistan from sanctuaries in Afghanistan led to serious frictions with Kabul. Attacks by Baloch insurgents became more audacious in 2025.

item.title: The Modi Juggernaut Was Unstoppable in 2025
item.description: The BJP clinched victories in all three major elections this year: the assembly elections in the states of Delhi and Bihar as well as the vice presidential poll.
